Name: Similar to szOID_CMC_ADD_EXTENSIONS. Attributes replaces Extensions.
Any Purpose
Description: The applications that can use the certificate are not restricted

Name: Microsoft Trust List Signing
Description: The certificate can be used to sign a CTL

Name: Qualified Subordination
Description: The certificate can be used to sign cross certificate and subordinate certification authority certificate requests. Qualified subordination is implemented by applying basic constraints, certificate policies, and application policies. Cross certification typically requires policy mapping

Name: Key Recovery
Description: The certificate can be used to encrypt and recover escrowed keys

Name: Document Signing
Description: The certificate can be used for signing documents

Name: Lifetime Signing
Description: Limits the validity period of a signature to the validity period of the certificate. This restriction is typically used with the XCN_OID_PKIX_KP_CODE_SIGNING OID value to indicate that new time stamp semantics should be used

Name: Microsoft Time Stamping
Description: The certificate can be used to sign a time stamp to be added to a document. Time stamp signing is typically part of a time stamping service

Name: Windows TCB Component
Description: Trusted Computing Base

Name: Preview Build Signing
Description: Windows Insider program

Name: Server Gated Crypto
Description: Can use strong encryption in export environment

Name: Serialized
Description: Can use strong encryption in export environment
Unknown, found in WDAG container WDAC policy

Name: Isolated User Mode (IUM)
Description: Virtualization-based security (VBS) enclave

Name: Encrypting File System
Description: The certificate can be used to encrypt files by using the Encrypting File System

Name: File Recovery
Description: The certificate can be used for recovery of documents protected by using Encrypting File System (EFS)

Name: Enclave
Description: New virtualization-based security (VBS) enclave

Name: Windows Hardware Driver Verification
Description: The certificate can be used for Windows Hardware Quality Labs (WHQL) cryptography

Name: Windows System Component Verification
Description: The certificate can be used for Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, and Windows 2000 cryptography

Name: OEM Windows System Component Verification
Description: The certificate can be used for used for Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) Windows Hardware Quality Labs (WHQL) cryptography

Name: Embedded Windows System Component Verification
Description: The certificate can be used for Windows NT Embedded cryptography

Name: Root List Signer
Description: The certificate can be used sign a certificate root list

Name: Digital Rights
Description: The certificate can be used for digital rights management applications
Microsoft Licenses

Description: The certificate can be used for key pack licenses

Name: License Server Verification
Description: The certificate can be used by a license server when transacting with Microsoft to receive licenses for Terminal Services clients

Name: Special RDN containing the KEY_ID. Its value type is CERT_RDN_OCTET_STRING
Microsoft extension in a CTL to add (0) or remove (1) the certificates
Microsoft certificate extension containing cross certificate distribution points
CTL Usage
Description: The certificate can be used to sign a request for automatic enrollment in a certificate trust list (CTL)

Name: Certificate Request Agent
Description: The certificate can be used by an enrollment agent

Name: Smart Card Logon
Description: The certificate enables an individual to log on to a computer by using a smart card

Name: Directory Service Email Replication
Description: The certificate can be used for Directory Service email replication

Name: Private Key Archival
Description: The certificate can be used for archiving a private key on a certification authority

Name: Key Recovery Agent
Description: The certificate is used to identify a key recovery agent

Description: ELAM

Name: HAL Extension
Description: Hardware abstraction layer
